result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark T Fogel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Submit to an AODA  Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random drug tests.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark T Fogel

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel

Approved by Judge Maxwell 3/11/16
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark T Fogel in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called off the record. Matter to be adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-07-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Mark T Fogel in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for her client to continue in treatment and asking for a plea and sentencing in 60 days. State has no objections. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 01-07-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Mark T Fogel in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for the status of the defendants treatment program that he just got into.  Hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 12-02-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Mark T Fogel in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment so her client can undergo some treatment before the matter gets resolved. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 10-02-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Mark T Fogel in court with attorney Jillian Scheidegger.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense given discovery by the State. Defense requests another date for hearing in October. Court grants request. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Attorney Cafferty
Hearing on August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark T Fogel in court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is recommending a jail sentence. Defendant would like to speak with the public defender. Court orders the defendant to go to the public defender's office now and then come back to court today.  Defendant makes too much mone for public defender.  Defendant wishes to hire an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any co-actor,  victim/witness/business (Target store)  listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Mark T Fogel in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
